topic.title: Extension to print file reporting

topic.title: State for region family (or cell selection family) table

body.p: An extra column showing the total pore volume at reference conditions has been added to this table. The new column, named 'Reference Pore Volume', appears after the 'Dynamic Pore Volume' column. This column is output when VerbosityLevel is set to 2 or higher for the RegionFamily, CellSelectionFamily, or RegionFamilyMgr nodes.

The column named 'Average Pressure' has been renamed to 'Average Pressure HCPV weighted' to explain that the values it shows are calculated using the hydrocarbon pore volume weighting method. This distinguishes the existing column from the new column that follows it named 'Average Pressure PV weighted' where the values are calculated using pore volume weighting. This new column (Average Pressure PV weighted) is output when VerbosityLevel is set to 2 or higher for the RegionFamily, CellSelectionFamily, or RegionFamilyMgr nodes.

topic.title: Surface fluid moles in place table and wet gas volume in place table

body.p: INTERSECT can now report the surface fluid moles in place for total hydrocarbon and the wet gas volume of the total hydrocarbon in place (which is equivalent to the ECLIPSE 300 'Hydrocarbon surface volume' report). These reports are output when the VerbosityLevel is 3 or higher for the RegionFamily, CellSelectionFamily, or RegionFamilyMgr nodes.

topic.title: Wet gas volume in place table

body.p: INTERSECT now allows the reporting of wet gas volume in place for each component in addition to the moles and mass in place. This is reported in the 'Wet Gas Volume in place' table, which follows the 'Mass in place' table in the PRT file. For each region in the chosen region family or cell selection, this table shows the wet gas volume in place for each component present. This table is only output if the VerbosityLevel field for the appropriate RegionFamily, CellSelectionFamily, or the parent RegionFamilyMgr is set to 3 or higher.
